element_texts.text: Completed

Road Making
from
Cantonment I.T.
to
Caldwell K.S.
Nov 6 / 79 to 
Dec 7 / 79
[Printed on Notebook cover:  NOTICE - TO RETAILERS AND CONSUMERS:  - Books made by other manufacturers must not be used or fitted to our flexible covers, as both book and cover are patented.  REYNOLDS & REYNOLDS DAYTON, OHIO]
Completed

Gypsum Creek   Novr 6. 79
I had previously made preparations for a trip to complete my road to Pond Creek - but the day was so dark and lowering that I concluded to put off my start until the weather looked more favorable - About 10 am it had so far improved that I decided to attempt it any how - & ordered my party to load the wagons - It was a slow job but we finally got off at 11.15 am




I had previously made preparations for a trip to complete my road Creek--but the day was so dark and
Completed

gun, lots of ammunition, & my dog. In all respects I am well fixed & if we dont have a good time it will not be from lack of preparation. Some time ago I sent Chapman out to locate a better road through the black Jack timber & Sand hills north of the post. He succeeded very well. We came over the route today. It is much better than the other road & at least 1½  miles nearer. 

 At 3½ we camped
Completed

The party consists of myself, Lt Lockwood (my engineer & map maker), a Corporal & 6 Infantry, & one mountain man - Chapman (the Interpreter) & 3 teamsters & Joe Laura & the baby. I have a 6 mule team, a 4 mule team & an ambulance - I have my horse - Lockwood one & Chapman & the orderly each one - My Comd. has rations until 20th & forage until 16th - I have my rifle, shot
Completed

Walnut Ck
Nov. 7, 79
Took it easy this morning & started at 8:30 am - while the wagons were being packed. I found a covey of true western quail - I got them up three times, bagged 3 birds, & wounded two more which I did'nt get, but I could not get the covey scattered. They rose as one bird & were off like shot every time. Put up stakes at the point where my
Completed

in a very beautiful spot on Gypsum Creek. A large sand bed with but little water now & that unfit for use, tho' the animals like it. We brought along enough for supper & breakfast. The day turned out well & we had a pleasant march Kept on road - did not hunt at all -  saw no game - To bed very early - Distance 11 miles -
Completed

Long shot 400 yds at a running wolf, another at same 500 yds, Covered him with dust each time - Scraped the top of another running rascall at 200 yds - Bagged 2 enormous rattlesnakes. Camped on Walnut Creek 3 pm. Nice camp, plenty of Turkeys, all hands turned out at dark, but the night is too dark, the leaves yet too thick. I bagged only 2. Tho' I killed 4. Richard killed 3, bagged 1 -
Completed

road leaves the old one, & planted occasional stakes all along though I dont think they are needed as the trail is pretty well marked - Any ordinarily good plainsman can follow it. Had quite a little spurt of excitement, as we came towards the Cimarron Divide - Fired a shot with my rifle at an owl about 80 yds off & plugged him through & through Centre
Completed

I shall look for a good bridge crossing of this creek. If I cant find it, I will ross on my old trail.

 I hope to bag a deer tomorro --
 Weather perfect -
 It is blowing a gale now, 10 pm - but is not cold -
 It did the same last night so I hope for a good day tomorro -
 Distance 15 miles -
 Game all told 13 Turkeys - 3 quail - 1 owl & 2 rattlesnakes
Completed

Boon killed 4, bagged 2. The soldiers did well as they had rifles & bagged 7 or 8, tho they shot lots of times. The firing was like a small battle, what with the dense thicket & the unusual exercise, I broke down early & came back covered with perspiration in ¾ of an hour. We remain here tomorro a party goes back to work the road passed once today -
Completed

Just as I finished my meal L. made his appearance draggled miserable but happy -- "What did you get" I asked. "I have only one here," he replied, "but I have 15 more cached up at the roost & I wish you would let me take a wagon & go for them before the wolves get at them" --
 I made him get his breakfast & then sent out the ambulance & we soon had all his 16 drawn & hung up --
Completed

Walnut Ck
Nov. 8. 79-
There was last night some talk of a hunt this am by moonlight - that luminary only getting up about 2 am - but during the night it commenced raining & kept at it until about 7 am  I laid snug & cozy in my bed & when finally I was forced to get up by the importunates of Laura that breakfast would be spoiled - I could not find Lockwood
Completed

go" & coming on a covey of quail. I went at them - killed 7 - one single & 3 right & left which did me more good than 6 turkeys - Found several flocks of turkeys - & had a dozen shots, in knocked over at least a dozen birds - but I bagged but four - I have been shooting by preference unclear 4 shot - & am now disgusts with them -

 I have not killed - that is bagged a single turkey with no 4 The turkeys are not
Completed

I sent Chapman with the Coopl & 5 men to work the bad places on the road we came over yesterday - & about 9 am I started to kill a deer if possible. Went up the creek. Lockwood Joe & my orderly with me - Looked in vain for a deer or even a  deer track - The Indians have cleared these out effectually - There were plenty when I came over the route before Finding the deer "no
Completed

& fixed upon the point where the road is to cross - Cant make a bridge as I wished as the drift wood indicates water higher than I can make a bridge with my force -

 Chapman & the party got back about 3 pm & report the road all good  - Have determined to send Boon in tomorro with Turkeys - I have 26 hanging in front of my tent & if we do well tomorro. I hope to send in at least 40
Completed

get fat & they have a great deal of vitality -

 Twice today I knocked over 2 at a shot only to see them get up & go off. I finally got mad & commenced putting No 2 Elys wire cartridges with them & all the birds I bagged are due to them --
 Lockwood got one & Joe none --
 It turned very cold while we were out & I came home early --
 Examined the creek
Completed

Walnut Creek
Novr 9, 1879
Punctually at 4 O clk the sentinel called me - I was already wide awake for I am getting into the bad habit of old men of anticipating the hour - I was anxious to send a big lot of Turkeys to the post & was a little excited & nervous -

 In a short time horses were ready & we started - & then commenced a series of misfortunes
 As the Indian would say "my medicine has been very bad today"-- First of all one of Boons /Boon in the
Completed

Have written to Clarke for a lot of things especially more ammunition 

 Just at dusk Lockwood Joe & I went out again to try the roost of last night - Joe found one solitary bird - bagged it. The others evidently think this an unhealthy neighborhood 
 Weather still cloudy but dreary & has moderated much - Game today 25 Turkeys 7 quail - 
 The men got tonight 2 
 Total Turkeys 38 -
Completed

terrible accident happened.

 I sneezed suddenly & violently & my teeth flew out on the prairie -
 Imagine the situation a frantic man groping for his teeth at 4 in the morning of a dark night & in the midst of a grass covered prairie - refusing all assistance for the careless tread of a heavy foot would either demolish or send them out of sight in the soft sand.
 At last I had to give it up & tying my handkerchief to a swale bush very
Completed

driver of my ambulance a character & very useful man) mule had got loose in the night & when we started it insisted on following - We had got out several hundred yards when we found it out. I wanted Boon to go with the post today & didn't want to risk losing the mule in the Black Jack / where it would become perfectly wild in a week )

So all turned back driving the mule - About 300 yards from camp a
Completed

heard I at once suspected that those rascally soldiers had been in here last night. I had told them to go lower down -

 Up & up the creek we went -- Day was breaking & not a turkey was to be seen but now I could see the tracks of those d_____ soldiers. Excuse me I was mad for every thing went wrong. More than a million of twigs stuck in my eyes. I was hung by Bamboo briers Several hundred times & pitched down banks on
Completed

near the scene of the catastrophy - I went back stirred up Boon had the mule caught & went on with the hunt -

 But the stiffening had been taken out of me - My loss worried me to be reduced to "gumming it" after enjoying the luxury of teeth. Visions of dyspepsia assailed me 
 Finally we arrived at the Turkey roost & entered the dark thicket - All was silent, not a Turkey to be seen or
Completed

the piping of those on the ground, calling on their lazy companions to get up -- or down -- I got into the creek & tried to wade up under cover of the banks - but each tree was vacated by the time I came within shot. 

 In utter desperation I sent a wire cartridge after one or two of the latest goers. They then went rapidly enough & the only consolation I have is that by the time one or more
Completed

numberls occasions by roots & briers.

At last I came upon a little rise that overlooked a semi-circular little bottom. & every tree that fringed the stream was ornamented with Turkeys until it appeared like the old pear tree in grandfathers yard.
 But that is all the good it did. It was already so light that they were beginning to leave the roost & the air was resonant with
Completed

suppose they did'nt find those teeth -

 Laura called out the breakfast was ready. Instead of responding with my usual alacrity I walked out to visit the searchers - coming with triumph in their faces - Boon had found them in good order- & as reward I immediately forgave him the scolding I intended to give him for letting his mule get loose in the night --
Completed

are food for wolves - (& I dont seem to derive much consolation from that either)

Coming back, I caught one fellow asleep & bagged him - & we got one other - Reached camp soon after sunrise & put Boon Chapman & all intelligent teamsters to looking for my teeth. 
The salvation was an anxious one - an exalted breakfast was almost ready.  My appetite was ferocious but
Completed

After breakfast set the Corpl & party to making a crossing of this creek. Then went with Chapman out to the Black Jacks to see if my original route through them can be improved. Left him to look up the situation & went off on an earnest & faithful effort to get a deer -- Hunted a mile & faithfully as some in my life & did'nt even see a track

 There were plenty here when I made the first
Completed

Ah, how I did enjoy the quail on toast - the beefsteaks, the turkey hash the more than delicious batter cakes - the rich? coffee etc etc. Tis said that a man enjoys life more after having been in great danger of losing it. I doubt the proposition but I can aver from my own experience that a man never enjoys a breakfast ore than when he has just escaped the terrible danger of losing his teeth --
Completed

off - Squirrel shooting with a good rifle has more charm for me than any other sport - & a squirrels head seems to have some peculiar attraction for a rifle ball. I'd rather shoot at the head any time than at the body - & easily fail to hit it -

 Got home in time for a good dinner Then took a nap for an hour -
 Joe wanted to go in to the post with Boon so they got off about 9 am with 28 Turkeys
Completed

route across. The Osage Indians have been camped for 2 weeks on this creek & have completely cleaned out the deer. Not enough are left for word scratched out seed -- On my return I went with the creek bottoms to try & get some quail for breakfast. Found none, but did find 3 squirrels - which I  bagged. 2 with shot gun & one with rifle from the top of a high cottonwood.

 Could see only a part of his head but knocked that
Completed

Walnut Ck
Nov 10, 79
Slept the sleep of the Just - That is I waked up only periodically when Fanny my pointer bitch made a rush at the wolves to whom she will not be reconciled I have argued the point with her in words & remonstrated with a strap but whenever the wolves commence their unclear notes, she goes into a scramble? a unclear & a howl of defiance to meet them -

 Breakfasted late
Completed

Just after dark one of my Indian scouts came in with a note from Broderick - about the transfer of Routzalin

 Broderick has hunted on his own account today & got one swale duck. 
 Wrote an answer to be sent back tomorro -
 Broderick & Chapman spent the evening with me - played solitaire then went at this -
 Game - 2 Turkeys 3 Squirrels - 1 duck -
 Stopped the men shooting as punishments for last night
Completed

Walnut Creek
Novr 11th 1879
Started about 4 am - went up on other side of creek - as the best travelling - for about 4 miles - when we reached what I took to be my roost. We dismounted & tied our horses & went in word scratched out A very short examination showed we were mistaken. The roost was near 4 mile above. Clarke came out of the thicket about same time I did. Day was just breaking. There was no time to go back after horses so we started on a "go-as-ya-please" for the roost
Completed

Sent out my working party about 9 am

Lockwood & I started down the creek - saw some ducks but got none
Made a careful hunt after deer - & am fully satisfied there are none here - Ambulance came back from Cant about 4 pm. Clarke also in his wagon to have a hunt - We are to start 3:30 am Towns are not very sanguine. Camp moves tomorro - Men get 3 turkeys Total 42 -
Completed

the time we got through our breakfast it began to rain

 The tents were all down except the mess tent so I had one or two pitched to shelter things that might get damaged by the rain. For two hours it came down in torrents & when it finally began to clear I had the old camp re-pitched as the prairie was too soft to travel over all.
 In the afternoon we went out & got some quail. The day turned out well & we enjoyed it -
7 turkeys 9 quail - 
Total Turkeys 49
Completed

Twas a beautiful sight
Hundreds & hundreds of Turkeys were in sight at once - but that was bad for our success in getting them. It was too late. At the first fire the large majority went away to the Black Jacks - All of us worked hard & by a little after sunrise, I yelled the boys together - having already sent my orderly back for the horses.

Our bag was light. I had five but the others only had one each. We got back to camp at 9 am. The clouds looked very threatening & by
Completed

Pond Creek today & another to the Station Agent at Pond Creek -

 Pond Creek --
 This morning the first thing I started the Indian on to Pond Creek with these letters. Last night Clark & Lockwood made up another hunt for this morning. I plead exemption on account of age two midnight starts in succession being too much for me - They started however at 3.30 am. while I rolled over & took another snooze - got up about sunrise & busied
Completed

Turkey Creek
Wednesday Novr 12  79

I was so tired last night that I did not do justice to my diary - About dark an Indian arrived with our mail from the post. A letter from Father & Mother One from Cath. One from Mrs Leiut Dodge inviting me to stay at her house during my visit to Fort Leavenworth to meet Julia & Fred. One or two on business & some papers.
 Wrote a letter to Jordan who ought to be at
Completed

pulled out at the same time for the post --

 I forgot also to mention in my yesterdays diary that I gave the men permission to go out hunting in the afternoon after we all got back & they returned at dark with 3 turkeys -- This am before I was up a man discovered a Turkey in a tree near camp & bagged him. I gave all the Turkeys we had to Clark to take in to the post 
 There were only 7 all
Completed

myself in various ways until they returned about 7.30 am. They had one Turkey. Not having my efficient guidance they arrived late at the roost & Lockwood in carelessly handling his gun, let it go off - when all the Turkeys followed suit & went off also - Clarke got only two long shots at flying birds -- but got none -- Camp was struck as soon as we got breakfast & at 9.30 am we started - Clarke
Completed

After swinging around a pretty wide circle, I came on to my road, & met my party & wagons just coming through the Black Jacks on east of Walnut Ck

 Joined & came on with them. Arrived at Turkey Ck about 2 pm. Joe rode down to water his mule & scared up 3 fine mallard
 Soon after he dislodged a snipe, which after tearing around in the air for some time came near enough to give me a long & difficult shot -- But I bagged him all same
Completed

told - for I never take away any from the men -- When the camp broke I started up the Creek - well to the west in the Black Jacks for I still have vision of deer - I hunted carefully but did not see a single deer - & scarcely a fresh trail - I however came on to a couple of huge old gobblers & bagged one of them. I also bagged 3 quail - regular old fellows - born & bred in the Black Jacks -
Completed

Lined out: Wild Horse Cold Water Creek
Novr 13th  79-
I took it so leisurely about getting up that the crossing was done almost by the time I was up - & we did not get off until about 9 am.

 It was very cold though clear when I got up but by the time we were ready to start it had every appearance of s furious storm.
 However I went on in by noon it was clear & warm - It is now
Completed

As soon as camp was pitched I put the men to work making a crossing of this creek. They have not yet finished it, but it will be done by 8 am tomorro - & a good crossing it will be. I have changed my road here from my preliminary line making 9t straighter & saving two bad crossings -- Day perfect

Game today 3 Turkeys 3 quail 1 snipe 1 opossum - 3 rattlesnakes.
Total Turkeys 55
         Quail 22
Completed

he yelled out in great excitement that a large panther was going off from the other side not 30 yards off - Slipping in  wire buck shot cartridge I ran after him but the grass was too high & he disappeared over a hill 300 yards away. He was an enormous fellow - I then returned to my quail hunting

In the edge of a similar thicket a little further on my dog came to a staunch point - as the little
Completed

cloudy again & looks like snow. We have been very fortunate in weather & at this season can hardly hope to escape a storm before we get in.

 Made a good crossing of another pretty bad creek. While the men were at work I took my dog & went down the creek to look for quail. There were several small thickets of young willow & tall grass. Joe was on the bank behind me & as I went into one thicket
Completed

with a whole load of No 7 shot - & such running as he did. I never saw before - 

 The little bitch was good pluck for she ran him for full 300 yards, he however going 5 feet to her one - Had I had any suspicion of there being another panther then I might have got him with buck shot - 
 I am terribly sorry I did not get him Though I have been tickled ever since with the idea
Completed

willows were almost too high to shoot word lined out in well. I tried to make her flush the birds - but she would not, so I walked in barrels charged with No 7 shot & all ready for snap shooting - From just under my feet, not more than a yard from me - a huge panther bounded into the thicket - He startled me but before he had gone 15 yards I filled his bottom
Completed

a letter from the Mail Agent at Pond Creek - 

 Jordan has not been heard from & I have about given him up --
 I will know tomorro for sure -
 This is a day of a new experience - for in all my frontier life & after killing numbers of panthers I have never before had one pointer by a bird dog nor shot at him with No 7 shot - 
 Its too funny -- have enjoyed it all day --
Completed

after the terrible stories of panthers that I read in my juvenile days to find my pointer standing one like quail & I putting a load of quail shot into him is too funny.

I put in proper loads & hunted all around, tho as I know they generally go in couples. I hardly expected to find more. I got no quail - nor game of any sort.
 Joe got one prairie chicken
 My Indian met me this afternoon - bringing
Completed

plenty of it) was frozen

 The day broke clear - the sun rose clear & it was clear - But the sun's rays soon thawed out the frozen moisture - There was heat enough to thaw but not enough to evaporate -
  Consequently a dense fog -
  By 11 am it was clear & the afternoon was warm
  Taken all together it has been a delightful day --
 No work en route so we arrived at Pond Ck by 12.30 pm - I am well satisfied with my new road
Completed

Pond Creek I.T.
Novr 14, 1879
The sun rose clear & beautiful, but he had hardly pushed his rosy face above the horizon than the heretofore clear atmosphere was changed into mist & the whole of our surroundings was at once enveloped in a dense fog -- I have never seen it come on so before but have found a theory.

The night was pretty cold All the moisture in the atmosphere (& there was
Completed

Wrote to Father - Mother at night -
Caused Lockwood to make an itinerary of the route to be stuck up on Mililys door - If the Grangers dont take my road after that, they may suffer on the old -

 Shot at an antelope at about 6 or 7 yds but didn't get him The only one seen on the trip --
 Bagged 1 grouse - game more than scarce today
Completed

It is nearer & far better

 Had a long talk with Milily (the owner of this station) about the country Indians etc He is very enthusiastic over the new road, & as we agree in our general ideas about things I think him a very intelligent man, especially as he gave me two beautiful female pigs -
 Jordan is not here - nor has any one heard of him - I dont know what to make of the matter & have about given him up --
Completed

but he had a very good one nevertheless. We got off at 8 am. I left word for Jordan to come out or send out if he should come by today's stage but I do not expect him.

 Put up a notice about the new Road at the station & put in a heavy sign post at fork of road --
 There is a most plentiful lack of game in this region
 Have seen today 1 antelope 2 grouse & about 8 quail --
 Bagged 1 grouse & 3 quail.
 Camped 19 miles from Pond
Completed

Saturday  Panther Creek

                  Novr 15, 1879

Paid Janatt (the man who keeps the mail station for the chickens I got & also for feeding my Indian & his pony- Millily was to have come out with me to this camp but went out early & did not return.

 A cattle man's life is more than slavery - Boxed the pigs in the front end of a wagon & I hope they are comfortable - Laura was sick in the night & not able to cook breakfast.
Completed

Walnut Ck
Sunday Novr 16, 79 -

Absolutely nothing to record except that I practically finished my road today making seasonal "cut offs" & driving stakes to mark the proper route - 
There is no game on this route one might as well travel through a desert -
The country is very pretty prairie plains, cut up by water courses & dry ravines on many of which there is timber 
 Saw some antelope & 3 deer
Completed

Ck on the creek where I encountered the panthers. 

 As soon as I got to the place, I loaded with wire Buck Cartridge & scoured all the thickets there but Mr & Mrs Panther had moved. No sign of them since we were here 
 Found one small covey of quail & got 3 - ought to have had more but for Lockwood - to whom I gave half the shooting, & who did not get anything - Laura all right tonight -
 Day delightful . The last two nights very cold
Completed

He & Chapman went out at dark to get turkeys -
I hope they may succeed - 
I would not go because my horse's back is sore.

 They are not likely to get much for we are camped only about 1½ miles above our old camp on the creek & every portion here & for two or three miles above has been hunted over again & again
 Boon tried hard to get a deer this afternoon but failed.
 Looks like a storm tonight
 If it comes I'll go in tomorrow
Completed

but they did not tempt me to break the Sabbath or rather the Sunday (the days being different)

 I did however shoot a prairie dog making five holes in & through him apparently in opposite directions with a single rifle bullet -
 I brought him in & showed him to Chapman & Boon but none of us can pose him to correspond with the evident path of the bullet 
 20 miles -- lovely day - tho' windy - Reduced to ham & bacon No fresh meat, unless Lockwood brings in some tonight
Completed

Cantonment
Novr 17, 79
A real old fashioned norther struck us last night - A terrific wind & very cold - Made up my mind that the sooner I got home the better for all hands. Started with ambulance before the wagons were packed - at 8 am -

 Caught two coons out on the Cimarron bottom & bagged them - Nasty musky windy disagreeable day - Rode my horse for about 8 miles
Completed

I would be ashamed of the record if this were a real hunt - as the doings of a party engaged in the laborious work of opening a new road, it may do but even the cook turns up her nose at sportsmen who cannot furnish fresh meat for daily consumption -

 No deer, no antelope, quail    all told would be only a tolerable days hunt in NC while ducks & grouse are hardly enough to count.
 Our Turkey record is all that redeems us --
Completed
After dinner we visited the Ladies - or some of them - wound up at Hay's He is celebrating his Tin wedding tonight - Gibson plead business & we got away in good season.
Completed

then took to the ambulance

 We made good time & reached home 2 pm (27 miles-) Found all right - Directed Lockwood & wagons to camp at Gypsum Ck - Joe greatly used up by the cold today.
 Rice & others from Ft Supply have been here went back this am.
 Paymaster arrived at 3 pm found me all in a pucker. Randall invited us to dine with him & so it was arranged
Completed

in one day. Wrote to Father & Mother - to Chitz? & to Coppinger?. The papers say Freds Troupe is "busted" & gone back to NY. I have therefore written to Cop, that I dont want to go to Ft 11worth. 

 Men continuing their drunk & have had to put a number in the Gd House. This is unusual with me for my men have behaved so well that I have had no guard
 not a prisoner to look after

Newbery Library Chicago seal in lower center
Fred refers to Col Dodge's son, Frederick Paulding (Dodge), who is a Shakespearean actor traveling with a troupe out of New York City.
Completed

Cantonment
Novr 18 -
Gibson paid the troops & we are having a high old drunk tonight -

 More than half the enlisted men of the Comd are under the influence of liquor, but they are  very quiet.

Novr 19 -
Gibson left at day light for Supply - Have given Randall & Dr Comfort a leave for a week to go to Supply. They start tomorro & go through
Completed

Novr 21 - 22d 25 -
Nothing of importance
Wrote letters to Father & Mother - to each & several on business - to go off on mail trains -
Novr 24th
Clarke & I had fixed on a hunt for Thanksgiving
Took out 2 unclear and teams & 3 men to help & started at 11 am today -- Went up the river about 1½ miles

I got 2 ducks 2 quail & one turkey -
 Clarke was in bad
Completed

Novr 20
Randall & Comfort got off early this am

Very cold for the season 
Masons not doing much
Everything else going on well - Birch Kiln burned & all ok
Novr 21

Not a thing of consequence
My horses back is sore (not my doing) & I cant get out - Lovely day & I wanted an "outing" - but couldn't get it - Am trying to buy a good Indian pony

Set Chapman at it ---
Completed

Novr 21 - 22d 25 -
Nothing of importance
Wrote letters to Father & Mother - to each & several on business - to go off on mail tomorrow

   Novr 24th

Clarke & I had fixed on a hunt for Thanksgiving
Took out 2 unclear and teams & 3 men to help & started at 11 am today - Went up the river about 1½ miles

I got 2 ducks 2 quail & one turkey -
Clarke was in bad
Completed

Novr 20 -
Randall & Comfort got off early this am

 Very cold for the season
 Masons not doing much
 Everything else going on well - Birch Kiln burned & all ok
                         Novr 21

Not at thing of consequence
My horses back is sore (not my doing) & I cant get out - Lovely day & I wanted an "outing" - but couldn't get it - am trying to buy a good Indian pony
Set Chapman at it ---
Completed

Nov 25th 79-
passed a good night & was up by sun up.

 Clarke & I started about half an hour before the wagons - going up the river & about a mile from camp had the mournful satisfaction of seeing a fine flock of Turkeys coming out of a wood that we had not thought of hunting last night
 We went after them & by good strategy I managed to get a long shot
Completed

luck & did'nt get anything - though he had good shots at both turkeys & quail.

I have'nt missed a shot today - & have done well for the game found

Camped where I expected to find a fine Turkey roost & after dark hunted faithfully without finding a bird - Weather perfect lovely camp. Sat out & enjoyed the moonlight until 9 pm - then went to bed - wrote this epistle & now go to sleep --
Completed

conceal himself. Mark a covey down go to the spot & the best dogs will get up only one or two birds - of the first covey profusely marked we got up but one bird which I bagged Of the second I got one & Monahan 2. The third consisted of only 4 birds & Clarke & I got all of them

 We were shooting for a supposition . Safe & by the best luck we came through the Sand Hills
Completed

which killed nothing but which scared them so badly that some of them squatted after their first flight.

I shot in poor luck knocking down four birds & bagging but one. Clarke also got one. We then came on. Found three flocks of quail & bagged altogether 8. I killed 4 Clarke 2 & Monahan 2. It is singular how completely this western quail can
Completed

& landed my fish which proved to be a Bass of 1¾ lbs -- My bait was beef & I have very rarely taken bass on beef - Went on with my work & in an hour took 5 Bass weighing all together 7 ¾ lbs - The largest 2½ - Smallest ¾ - & wound up with a pound catfish -

So my labor was "dolce" but not "far niente"   
 After dark we started to hunt a splendidly
Completed

directly upon it - & camped about 2½ pm.
After lunch, I told Clark that I would take my rod, stick it in the bank & enjoy the "dolce far niente". Smoking dozing & fishing at the same time -- for I really did not expect to catch any thing more than a small catfish - specially as the lake appears shallow -- After a while I got a bite
Completed

have driven or killed off the game -

 The day has been lovely, & I have enjoyed it all, though we got so little game -
 The Bass compensates -
 I'd rather have them than 5 Turkeys - I shall try them again tomorro morning - Clarke could not get a bite but he promises to be even with me tomorro -
 2 Turkeys 8 quail 5 bass 1 catfish -

Total 3 Turkeys 10 quail etc
Completed

appearing mass of timber for a Turkey Roost -- Hunted it all through - Found only a fringe of timber & not a single turkey Came back to camp disgusted by 7 pm 

 Let the men go out & they returned about 9 pm with nothing but having discovered a big camp of Pawnee Indians 2 miles below us & who have been hunting around here for a week &
Completed

to fishing with good success although it was an abominable day so far as wind was concerned until 11 am it looked like rain & blew like blazes. The fish were biting slowly but they did bite so I hated to leave them

 When I had about made up my mind to start my orderly told me that Corpl Beck who had gone out Turkey hunting last
Completed

Nov 26 - 79
The fates are against us on the Turkey question & our Thanksgiving has to be without that noble bird - This morning I expected to go to Osage Springs, alone on the river & where I found a splendid Turkey roost last Novr All our expert shots were out last night & not a single Turkey killed

 Immediately after Breakfast, I went
Completed

Of course we could not move. The scouts report Indians all around us -- a big Camp of Choctaws 2 miles below - another of Pawnees 2 miles above - No wonder we dont find any game 

 The Choctaws have killed 7 or 8 Bear & over 100 deer just about here
 Everything is run off & we have no chance 
 But Clarke & I have taken it all very quietly - We are
Completed

night had not yet returned & was supposed to be lost -- I at once ordered Boon & Monahan to go out & look for him --

 They came in about 11 am & reported seeing his track, but they couldn't find him - I sent them out again with orders to find him if they could do so before dark & gave them 2 good horses --
 They came back with him about 3 pm
Completed

Thanksgiving Day
Novr 27 1879

The wind changed in the night & by morning we had a Norther, not very cold but gloomy & disagreeable 
 Corpl Beck had been found the game was gone - our coffee & sugar were out so nothing remained but to go in specially as after hard trying the fish wouldn't bite Got 2 catfish during the night having left my line in the water. While getting ready to move a small covey of quail came to the Lake
Completed

so cleared the country of game that I shall go in tomorro - & next time I will keep away from the main streams
I am delighted with the discovery of this Bass pond or Lake - 

 Next time I come I'll have proper bait & make a record 
 We will go in tomorro though I hope to get a Bass or two before I start -
Completed

with a heavy thud & was sure I had hit him but when I came to examine his trail & found that he ran on all 4 legs & that there was no sign of blood I had to admit that I missed him

 Got in about 3 pm & found everything all right.
 Found letter from Father of 14th.
 Total of hunt
 Turkeys- 3
 Grouse 3    Ducks 3 -
 Quail  18    Bass 14
 Catfish  33
Completed

to drink. We got all but one. Clarke potting 4 on the ground the first shot & I bagging 3 single birds on the wing.

Going home we found only 3 grouse - I got 2 Clarke 1 - On small game I have shot unusualy wide on this trip - missing only one quail since I ve been out - I had a shot at a magnificent Buck about 200 yds standing head on facing me. I thought I would surely get him but I didn't.
 I heard the bullet strike
Completed

is out two of them sent away this am to accommodate other officers. So I had to rush around to see what I could do. Result that I start tomorro at 5 am or as soon aster as possible for Pond Ck. Clarke sends out a relay tonight & if all goes right we will reach Pond Ck tomorro night 67 mi

 This will get us in to 11worth on evening of 1st.
 I have been flying round lively since 12 m.
Completed

Cantonment Nov 28 79

Recd a telegram from Lt Dodge early this am telling me that the newspaper reports were false, that Fred would play in Leavenworth on 1st & 2d Decr - Made up my mind I could not get there in time & telegraphed to that effect. Mail came in about 12 m - bringing a letter from  Jordan telling me that the whole family would be in Leavenworth on 1st sending their love & begging me to meet them - Every ambulance & train I have
Completed

yet being visible -

 In the darkness & number of wood roads, we lost my new road, & got into the old one almost as soon as we had crossed the river.
 There was no time to lose in hunting nearer cuts & we went on --
 About 9 am we felt able to eat a little, & went for our lunch basket -
 At 10.45 am we came to my turkey camp on Walnut Ck where we found the team sent
Completed

Pond Ck. Novr 29 -

 Had given orders for a very early start. Laura called me at 4 am -
 Keeling who was to breakfast with me did not put in an appearance until nearly 5. We got our breakfast & found no wagon. He being the younger went off after it & in half an hour or so it came up.
 Loaded up  & got off at 6 am.- it being still very dark - only a few faint streaks of daylight
Completed

delightful - a little cool but the wind came from our rear & did not annoy us - Had we been riding against it we would have suffered. Some rascally grangers or hunters set fire to the Black Jack just ahead of us & we had to run the guantlet crossing the line of fire twice - It looked a trifle squally for a few moments, but we got through all right.

 Saw a great number of wolves & some antelope
Completed

out last night. It was a pair of little rats? of mules - in excellent order - but after the big horses that had brought us so far looked too small to pull us --

 However we pulled out at 11.20 am & at 7.05 we reached Pole Ck having made 41½ miles in less than 8 hours with this same team of rats? --
 The whole distance 66½ miles was made in 13 hours exactly.
 The day has been unclear
Completed

20 x 18 - 2 stories high -
6 people occupied the upper room Lined out: story. Keeling & I sleeping in one bed -

 The lower floor was occupied by the Ranchman & wife, five children & 2 dogs - I being awake & consequently not snoring our room was quiet enough 
 Down stairs was different 
 First the baby (4 months commenced yelling & was after unclear & patience quieted by its mother
 Then the puppy (which must be burnt itself
Completed

I had my rifle along but my bullet pouch was mislaid & hid among our numerous wraps & bundles & I didn't get a shot.

 Had plenty of lunch along & lots to drink but was both hungry & thirsty on arrival at Pond Ck.
 We soon had supper & by 9 pm went to bed 
 Fell asleep at once only to wake up in half an hour. Heard the clock strike 10, 11 12 1 & 2 - 
 Pond Creek ranch consists of a log house
Completed

pup in again.

 Six times at least did that Ranchman have to get up & do something 
 At 12 o clk there was a loud rap on the door & a voice announced another belated wanderer.
 Janat went out & put up the team & the new comer was put to sleep on the floor among the puppys & babies -
 Soon after I went into the land of dreams of pork & late suppers  --
Completed

against the stove set up a piercing & prolonged wail. A series of wails which were only terminated by Janatt (the Ranchman collecting & dropping him out of doors - The noise waked the youngest boy 2 years - the owner of said pup - & hearing that pup yell he set up a yell in sympathy 

 An awful & interminable howl it was & finally to quiet the boy the unhappy ranchman had to get up & let the

At 1 pm arrived at Caldwell & got dinner.

 Started again at 2 pm with a fresh team & arrived at Wellington 6 pm 
 51 miles today in 9 hours put up at the Hotel Dr Bernard a shingle palace where a whisper is heard all over. This is a busy & growing town 
 Lots from $50 to $1500 - Every thing on a Boom - Dont think it will amount to much - & wont invest - 
 Keeling asleep long ago & now I'll follow suit -
 117 miles in 2 days
Completed
Completed

Wellington Nov 30 --
Up before the sun -

 The new comer of last night found to be our team telegraphed for by Keeling when it was decided we were to go on this trip -- Hugh our driver so far was ordered to return to the post. We were gentlemanly lazy about starting getting off at 8 am - We had a very good light wagon with curtains all around which proved very comfortable as the wind was very cold tho in our backs --
Completed

more. At 3 we left the Hotel & were soon speeding over the prairie at the rate of 30 miles an hour. 

 Struck all our connections just right & arrived at Leavenworth about 7 pm Went to the Hotel - put on some clean clothes got supper & then started out to look for the show people who were at another Hotel.
 All gone to the Opera House. There I found Jordan who introduced me to Mr Lawlor who is not managing the Comps?. Josia Jordan was
Completed

Monday Dec 1, 79
Slept like an Infant Angel until aroused by a knocking somewhere & a hoarse voice saying "2 O clock". As we were not to be called till 3 - & as there was no other? train or reason that I could see for getting up at that time - I imagined I had made a mistake in the call - That it must be 3 O clk & this worried me wide awake & I got up - Twas only 2 but I could sleep no
Completed

& watched him narrowly with a most critical eye & brain -

 In one of his falls in the last scene he missed the table on which he was to fall - & he & table went to the floor together - I supposed it intentional - After the curtain went down & the applause was over I went to Freds dressing room - He met me with the warmest hugs & kisses & every evidence of delight & told me
Completed

inside & Fred in his dressing room -  In a few moments the house began to fill. I would not go behind scenes to see Fred as I wanted to surprise him - No one knew that I was in town & I was running all over the house to see friends & being hand shakin all to pieces

Soon the curtain rose & in due time Fred came on so hideously made up that I would not have known my boy.
 I followed him closely
Completed

got in in good time to dress for it -- The whole post turned out to do us honor - & we had a glorious time - Freds play last night was the Fools Revenge - Tonight it is Hamlet - I cannot realize that the loving boy at home is the great actor on the stage. 

 His Hamlet is simply grand - better than any I have ever seen - It has been a proud & happy day for me -
Completed

that as he turned to fall on the table, he caught sight of me & was so surprised that he did not strike it properly 

 We all went up to the Fort. I stayed with Coppinger. Julia is to be here tomorro - We had a grand time - finally all got to bed 
 Tuesday Dec 2 -
 Lt Dodge went down for Julia as I had to attend to business - Mrs Lt D had arranged a reception & Julia
Completed

Thursday Dec 4
Happy Day - papers enthusiastic - Julia loving & happy - Fred as boyishly affectionate as if he were not a Star - Josie Jordan as sweet as pie - but we leave her here - much to our regret for she is a dear sweet girl - Lawlor & the Compy have taken a great shine to me & we are all a mutual admiration society, as proud & happy as possible Hamlet at night to a most enthusiastic House
Completed

Wednesday Dec 3d
The Company went to Kansas City this am

 Julia Fred & I unclear until evening -- I have been over whelmed with congratulations - Genl Pope says Freds Hamlet is the best he has ever seen & he has seen McCorady Forest Booth Barrete & all the other great Hamlets
 Have got acquainted with all the company - like them all - Excellent Articles in all the papers on Freds Acting -
 Fools Revenge at night
Completed

Sunday 7th -
Hotel so bad we determined to decamp - Took morning train to Atchison -

 Monday 8th Hamlet to a full & appreciative house - St Joe papers wild over the boy - as were also the Kansas City papers After performances had to cut & run to get the train for Omaha - Got off at 12 /--
 Tuesday 9 - Arrived at Omaha about 8 am -
 Excellent Hotel Withnell House - Met many of
Completed

Friday - 5th Left for St Jo - Had the stuffing taken out of us by a thrice miserable Hotel but the best in town - Fools Revenge to a small but most enthusiastic house - 

 Rainy bad night -
 Saturday 6th Matinee Lady of Lyons - Fred lovely as Claude Melnotte 
 At night a fair house to see Hamlet - perfectly enthusiastic - Called him out after every act - Applauded every point & unclear to want to take him off the boards -
Completed

were with me in the Black Hills called and these were the only calls we had - Those named Officers - Gentry & one 2d Lt went to the Matinee - "Lady of Lyons" done more beautifully than I have ever seen it - Burt who claims to be a literary & artistic unclear was very enthusiastic over the Boy - but not so enthusiastic as to come to see Hamlet at night

 Hamlet well nigh perfect in evening & not a single Officer
Completed

my old Citizen friend Jordan & I got the money matters arranged with the Bank - My $3000 has not yet been invested - The payor of the Mortgage having acted shabbily - Note from Bob Williams excusing himself & wife from coming down on unclear of sickness - 

 "Fools Revenge" at night
 Fair house but not an Officer - unclear
 Wednesday 10th 79 - Burt & Foote two of the Officers of 9th Infy who
Completed

all the prominent Officers had complimentary tickets which they did not use --

 The Citizens gave as a full & most appreciative House - & the papers are most complimentary
 This was to be my last night "with the show" so I determined to give the whole Company a supper party after the play -- Eighteen of us sat down to a Champagne & Oyster Supper & had a most glorious time - Julia & Fred were specially
Completed

or unclear Lady - I was told by a Citizen that there was some jealousy & I suppose that is the reason - though I think the real secret was that each man & woman was so concious of his or her own ignorance in such matters that they were really afraid to go -

 They would not have known when to applaud, or whether to applaud at all or not & they saved committing themselves by staying away -
 Some such reason must be at the bottom for
Completed

go back with me to Ft Leavenworth & remain there with me until I have to start for my post -

 I can't ever in parting do justice to my feelings & ideas with reference to the Boy - He is little short of a miracle - Only two years ago he was a backward boy playing in preferences with the smaller children - Now he stands forth not only as a perfect marvel in Shakespearian knowledge but as one of his very finest exemplars on the
Completed

delighted & it was really a Godsend to the poorer players - for I had every body - even to the baggage man -- We did not break up until near 3 am - When I shook hands with & wished good luck to all the men - kissed all the (pretty) women & went back to my Hotel -

 I think my dear old wife had "kinder" fallen in love with me again for she now insists that she will cut loose from the Boy for a few days --
Completed

stage. I have loved & read Shakespeare all my life, yet the boy of 20 shows me beauties & meanings I never before thought or heard of -

 In truth he is the "New Hamlet" & his rendition suits my idea better than that of any other player I have ever seen -- He has a most glorious future before him if he can only keep his health -
 With love & kisses
    The Boy Baby
       Rich
Completed
